page.title: 20MIDDLEWICH MANOR
page.content: {Middlewich Manor}, a local landmark, was built for the Court family in 1830 in the Greek style with Ionic pillars and friezes, and surrounded by a ha ha (a sunken fence). Most of its land has been used for housing _ 5.5 acres remain. In 1938 it was bought by the Fodens and leased during the war to a Manchester school for deaf and dumb children. Ownership transferred to British Alkali who used it for storage and a base for Polish evacuees From 1955-1984 it was occupied by the Willing Denton family. Now Dr. Jakina is converting it to a convalescent home. By 1986 it will have 40 centrally heated rooms, a nurse call system, fire proofing and new wiring but preservation orders on the marble fireplaces, carved ceilings, domed staircase, wood panelling and trees ensure they will remain unchanged.
